metadata.title: CVE-2014-1883 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Adobe PhoneGap before 2.6.0 on Android uses the shouldOverrideUrlLoadingcallback instead of the proper shouldInterceptRequest callback, whichallows remote attackers to bypass intended device-resource restrictions viacontent that is accessed (1) in an IFRAME element or (2) with theXMLHttpRequest method by a crafted application.

criterions.comment: cordova-ubuntu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
